title: Great Decentralization Thesis
summary: CEO predicts end of Big Tech AI hegemony through smaller, specialized models and employee-driven adoption outpacing IT-sanctioned tools

content.whatItIs: Snowflake CEO Sridhar Ramaswamy argues 2026 will be the year of the 'Great Decentralization'—the end of Big Tech walled gardens as smaller, specialized models deliver higher ROI than trillion-parameter alternatives.
howItWorks: Core thesis: 'You don't need the biggest models to do a lot of things'—smaller specialized models often outperform giants
The 'HTTP Moment': 2026 expected to see emergence of dominant protocol for agent collaboration, enabling interoperability
Strategic vs. Slop: Organizations split between generating 'AI slop' and 'Creative Amplification'
Employee-driven adoption: Workers using ChatGPT, Claude without waiting for IT, forcing organizations to catch up
Continuous learning imperative: Successful AI products build in feedback loops that improve far faster than static models
content.coreInsight: The future favors smaller, specialized models over trillion-parameter giants. Design for the 'Great Decentralization' by building modular AI capabilities that don't depend on Big Tech walled gardens. Accept that employee-driven adoption will outpace IT-sanctioned tools—build governance to catch up, not control.
content.keyMetrics: Acquired Observe (observability platform) early 2026 for AI system monitoring. As execution becomes commoditized, strategic thinking becomes the bottleneck.
